analytic.title: To the right honourable and my noble parts, My LORDS COMMISSIONERS appoynted for refor∣mation of diuerse abuses, and first of Tithes.

monogr.title: Respublica de decimis. Written by Sir VVilliam Cockburne of Langtoun Knight
monogr.author: Cockburn, William, Sir

div.head: To the right honourable and my noble parts, My LORDS COMMISSIONERS appoynted for reformation of diuerse abuses, and first of Tithes.
div.p: REason, by reason of some secreet surmising (beleeued by the weaker minds, and fostred by the more particularie inclined) that no reformation annent that matter of Tithes is intended, hath imployed mee (as one, whose interest it principally or rather onlie concernes,) Faithfully to report vnto your LL. the true mind of every severall part of my composition: as I haue receaued it from him my over Lord directour and resumer of euery particulare thought, not only of euery particular partie in this businesse, but euen of euerie particular person in whatsoeuer businesse hath potentia truely to thinke. But if any man bee curious to see my procuratory, let him search the hollow of his owne breast, there shall hee finde it.
